original: Ericson, Karl Harald Ossian, stadsarkitekt, Borås, f. 3/1/90 i Ailanäs, Jäm;tl. k, av lektor Olof E. o. Hanna Olsson. G. 30 m. Svea Norling. Barn: Olof f. 31, Ulla 35, Lars 37. — Avg:ex. fr. KTH 15. Res. t. Danm., Finl., Engl. 13 o. 20, t. Frankr., Ital., Tyskl. 20. Anst. h. arkit. Hahr, Sthilm-Västerås, 15, h. prof. Curman 16, h. Arvid Bjerke o. R. O. Svensson i Gbg 16-22, Gbgs-utst. arkit :kont. 19-22, eg. verk-isamh. 22-29, stadsarkit. i Borås fr. 29. Medl. av Rotary o. S. H. T. Hobby: sportfi|ske.
translated: Ericson, Karl Harald Ossian, city architect, Borås, b. 3/1/90 in Ailanäs, Jämtland county, son of lecturer Olof E. and Hanna Olsson. Married in 1930 to Svea Norling with whom he had three children: Olof (b. 1931), Ulla (b. 1935), and Lars (b. 1937). Graduated from KTH in 1915. Traveled to Denmark, Finland, and England in 1913 and 1920, and to France, Italy, and Germany in 1920. Employed by architects Hahr, Sthilm-Västerås, in 1915, by professor Curman in 1916, and by Arvid Bjerke and R.O. Svensson in Gothenburg from 1916-1922. Worked with the Gothenburg Exhibition Architectural Bureau from 1919-1922 before starting his own business from 1922-1929. Appointed as the city architect of Borås in 1929. Member of Rotary and the Swedish Society for Town and Country Planning. Hobby: fishing.

structured.name: Karl Harald Ossian Ericson

memberOf.name: Swedish Society for Town and Country Planning

structured.description: Karl Harald Ossian Ericson was a Swedish city architect, born on January 3, 1890 in Ailanäs, Jämtland County, Sweden to lecturer Olof E. Ericson and Hanna Olsson. He graduated from KTH Royal Institute of Technology in 1915 and worked at various firms before starting his own business from 1922-1929. In 1929, he was appointed as the city architect of Borås, where he worked until his death. He was a member of Rotary and the Swedish Society for Town and Country Planning, and enjoyed sportfishing as a hobby.
